perturbation.original_text:
D.  Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30) days of the Invoice date shall be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month
which is a corresponding ANNUAL
PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.changed_text: D.  Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30) days of the Invoice date may, at PCQ's sole discretion, be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month which is a corresponding ANNUAL PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a finance charge for late payments. The modified version introduces discretion, making it unclear whether late payments will always incur a finance charge. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
PCQ hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold ABW harmless, including reasonable attorney's fees, from and against any claim that the SOFTWARE or HYPERFEED infringes on the patent, copyright or other proprietary rights of another, including any and all claims, liabilities, or obligations resulting from PCQ's negligence, willful misconduct, misrepresentations, breach
of warranty or non-performance of any of the covenants or obligations under this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: PCQ may, at its sole discretion, defend, indemnify and hold ABW harmless, including attorney's fees, from and against any claim that the SOFTWARE or HYPERFEED infringes on the patent, copyright or other proprietary rights of another, including any and all claims, liabilities, or obligations resulting from PCQ's negligence, willful misconduct, misrepresentations, breach of warranty or non-performance of any of the covenants or obligations under this Agreement. However, PCQ's liability to indemnify is limited to the price ABW paid during the period of violation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text obligates PCQ to defend and indemnify ABW against infringement claims. The modified text makes this obligation discretionary, creating uncertainty about whether PCQ will fulfill this responsibility. This weakens ABW's protection against potential legal liabilities. It also contradicts to the clause stating ABW use of data is authorized, by introducing a fee liability.

perturbation.original_text:
Notwithstanding the provisions of (A), and (B) above, should a party
to this Agreement be in material breach of the Agreement, the other party may
terminate the Agreement thirty (30) days after notice of said material breach
is received, and only if such material breach is not cured within thirty (30)
days of receipt of notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding the provisions of (A), and (B) above, should a party to this Agreement be in material breach of the Agreement, the other party may terminate the Agreement. However, termination rights following a breach will be at the sole discretion of the non-breaching party and subject to review by PCQ's legal counsel before becoming effective.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a clear process for terminating the agreement due to a material breach. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating that termination is at the 'sole discretion' of the non-breaching party and subject to review by PCQ's legal counsel, potentially hindering ABW's ability to terminate if PCQ's counsel disagrees.
